label: 門跡
本: From Sovereign to Symbol: An Age of Ritual Determinism in Fourteenth Century Japan . Oxford University Press . 2012
説明文: A term originally meaning the transmission of Buddhist teachings, or a congregation became, by the thirteenth century, used to describe a temple headed by a prince, or for that matter, the prince himself. Kenshun was one of the first monzeki who was not of the imperial family.
